page.title: 01Farmland overlooking Ayr
page.content: This undulating agricultural countryside six kilometers to south west of Ayr at height of 100m is typical of Scottish South West in that it is essentially dairy farming land, with some hay turnips and barley one main road bisects area with a large number of smaller little used minor roads and lanes. The land rises towards the east and is reasonably well drained to the river Doon. In the north east is a loch with course fish, some trout and a fine seclection f water fowl. This area also has a good number of wild mammals from voles to red squirrel and deer. In the north west is a small industrial estate where two companies, one scottish and one american manufacturer and assemble electronic equipment printed circuits and silicon chips.
